news.title: Tesla shares have declined every week since Elon Musk went to Washington
news.summary: Tesla's stock has dropped for seven straight weeks, a stretch that dates back to the beginning of Donald Trump's second term in the White House.

news.title: China to impose retaliatory tariffs on some Canadian products as trade war heats up
news.summary: China announces retaliatory tariffs on Canadian agricultural goods. Ottawa slapped import duties on Chinese-made EVs. China says it will hit back with duties on Canadian-made electric vehicles.

news.title: Trump Organization sues Capital One bank over account closures after Jan. 6 Capitol riot
news.summary: The Trump companies accuse Capitol One of having "'woke' beliefs that it needed to distance itself from President Trump and his conservative political views"

news.title: Goodyear Tire's transformation plan is underway — in the sky and on the ground
news.summary: Goodyear Tire & Rubber Co. is facing a rapidly changing business. New technologies and increased competition from low-cost countries such as China.

news.title: Hinge Health to go public as soon as April, source says
news.summary: Hinge Health could file for an initial public offering as soon as next week, CNBC has learned. Hinge Health is a health care company that was founded in 2009.

news.title: Trump’s ‘chaotic’ policy approach is creating opportunity for investors
news.summary: There could be “quite a shift in the world order,” says Mike Cudzil, a portfolio manager at Pimco.

news.title: An Intel deal now seems less likely. These clues may hold the key to its future.
news.summary: Investors appear to be discounting recent M&A speculation that Intel will split in two. Intel is the world's second largest chip maker.

news.title: My husband gave his credit card to his son to pay for ‘medical bills.’ Does this kind of support send the wrong message?
news.summary: “This young man has been enabled financially by both of his parents, but especially by his mom’s,” he said.

news.title: How buyers are winning bidding wars in a market where homes are going for $620,000 over ask
news.summary: The spring home-buying season could be bruising in this region, where bidding wars are alive and well. The market is expected to be strong in the coming months.

news.title: America’s job market is eerily similar to the 1990s dot-com boom. Should we be worried?
news.summary: March 20 marks the 25th anniversary of the dot-com bust. Could it happen again? CNN's John Sutter looks at the possibility of a repeat.
